part.title: Array Center Staff Home: The Array Center Staff GUI Tool

sect1.title: Assign a New Order Number
sect1.para: When users ready to place an array order with the array center, they will submit the order. Depending on &product; configuration, the submission may or may not required special center approval before being forwarded to array center staff. Once the order is ready for processing, the array center staff will receive an email stating that the order has been submitted.

The first step in processing an order is to assing a order number. There are two ways to do this. Array center staff may click on the link in the notification email, or they may go the "Assign a New Order Number" page via &array_home;.

This page shows all array orders that do not have an order number assigned. First, select the appropriate order (it will be automatically selected the email link was clicked) and then click "Assign Order Number". This will assign the next order number in the sequence.

sect1.title: Create a New Array Order
sect1.para: Generally, array orders will be created when the user places an order with the array center. However, in rare circumstances array center staff may wish to create orders that are not yet associated with a study. This can be accomplished via the "Create a New Array Order" page. The first screen allows specification of the PI/group associated with the order. An array order can also be associated with special center if required.

The next screen is a confirmation screen. If you create the order via the the email link, you are taken directly to this screen as the other information is provided directly via the request link. To create the order, click on "Create Array Order".

sect1.title: Assign a Historical Order to an Existing Study
sect1.para: If array orders are created via the Create a New Array Order page, no array study will be associated with the order. Normally, users would create an order when study configuration is complete, however, if desired, the order can be associated with an existing order. Note that if some of the samples associated with the study are already associated with a different order, they will not be associated with the new order. Only samples that are not currently associated with an order will be assigned to the specified order when assigning a historical order to an existing study.

There are two ways to creatOe the array order: it can be created via the "Create a New Array Order" link or by clicking on the link in the request email. There are two screens associated with creating an order. The first screen allows specification of the PI/group associated with the order. An array order can also be associated with special center if required.
To assign a historical order to an existing study, first select the appropriate study. Then select the existing order. Finally, click on "Assign Order To Study".

sect1.title: Delete an Array Order
sect1.para: If an array order, has been erroneously created, only the array center staff can delete it. This is done via the "Delete an Order" link from &array_home;. To delete an order, simply select the appropriate order, then click on "Delete Order".
sect1.note: Orders cannot be deleted once loaded data is associated with them. Only orders with a status of "INCOMPLETE", "COMPLETE", "SUBMITTED", or "APPROVED" can be deleted.

sect1.title: View Reports
sect1.para: Reports screens provide information on the state of array orders. There are two reports: the order log and the billing log.
sect1.formalpara:
Order Log The order log contains the following fields:
Order #
This field specifies the order number that is used to uniquely identify the order. Note that the order number is a link. Clicking on the link will take you to the Get One Array Order interface for that order.
PI First
This field contains the PI's first name.
PI Last
This field contains the PI's last name.
Order Placed
This field contains the date when the order status became "Complete". Note that this does not necessarily mean that configuration of the array order has was completed, but rather that the configuration was is a valid state.
Chips Scanned
This field contains the date that the gene chip data was loaded.
Samples Received
This field is intended to contain the date that the array center receives the samples. In order for this field to be accurate, the data must be entered by array center staff via the Get One Array Order interface.
Report Completed
This field is intended to contain the date that the array center finishes the report on the experiment. In order for this field to be accurate, the data must be entered by array center staff via the Get One Array Order interface.
# of Samples
This field contains the total number of samples associated with the array order.
# of Chips
This field contains the total number of chips associated with the array order.
Chip Type
This field lists the chip type(s) associated with the array order (see layout).
Have Chips
This field is intended to contain information as to whether the array center has chips in stock to complete the array order. In order for this field to be accurate, the data must be entered by array center staff via the Get One Array Order interface.
Note that you can sort on any of the columns by pressing the button that is the column header.

Billing Log The billing log contains the following fields:
Order #
This field specifies the order number that is used to uniquely identify the order. Note that the order number is a link. Clicking on the link will take you to the Get One Array Order interface for that order.
PI First
This field contains the PI's first name.
PI Last
This field contains the PI's last name.
PATEO
This contains the billing code for the order. The billing code is set by the Member User when the initial array order is generated. Once submitted, the user is unable to modify the billing code.
Dept
This is the department associated with the PI. The department value is set when the user account is created.
Special Center
If the array order is associated with a special center, then the special center name is displayed here.
Isolations
Isolations defaults to the number of samples associated with the array order. If necessary, array center staff can override the isolation count using the Get One Array Order interface.
Preps
Preps are the total number of samples.
Chips
This field contains the total number of chips associated with the array order.
Total
This is the total amount of the bill for the array order. Currently, the formula is hardcoded and specific to the UVa array center. The formula is:
((38 *I) + (325 * N)) * (1 - (P/100) + T
I - number of isolations
S - number of samples
P - discount percentage for the special center associated with the array order
T - total chip cost for all chips associated with the order
Isolation Bill Date
This field is intended to contain the date that the array center bills for the isolations. In order for this field to be accurate, the data must be entered by array center staff via the Get One Array Order interface.
Preps Bill Date
This field is intended to contain the date that the array center bills for the preps. In order for this field to be accurate, the data must be entered by array center staff via the Get One Array Order interface.
Chips Bill Date
This field is intended to contain the date that the array center bills for the chips. In order for this field to be accurate, the data must be entered by array center staff via the Get One Order interface.
Note that you can sort on any of the columns by pressing the button that is the column header.

sect1.title: Brief View of All Array Orders
sect1.para: This is a summary screen that provides a smaller amount of information on all array orders. Information displayed includes the Order Number, the billing code, the contact name, the number of samples associated with the order, the name of the layout associated with the chip, and the total number of chips associated with the array order.

sect1.title: Get One Array Order
sect1.para: When an array order is ready for processing, &product; generates an email that is sent to array center staff. Processing activities are accessible via the "Get One Array Order" link. See below for a description of all activities:

callout.para: These links allow array center staff to view additional information (including contact information) for the owner and the creator or the order.
Click on the "Update" button to save changes to checkboxes and text fields.
This is the order number that uniquely identifies the array order.
If the array order is associated with a special center then the name of the special center is displayed here.

Several checkboxes are provided on this screen to allow array center staff to track significant events. Checkboxes include "Chips Ordered", "RNA Iso. Billed", "Have Chips", "Chips Billed", and "Analysis Billed".

The number of isolations is calculated automatically, but in rare instances array center staff may wish to override that value. This can be accomplished by manually changing the number of isolations in the text edit field on this screen.

This field allows array center staff to lock and unlock array orders. When an array order is locked, member users are unable to edit the array order. The order is automatically locked when it is submitted to the array center to prevent edits once order processing has begun. However, it is sometimes necessary to edit array order configuration if a mistake has been made. In these instances, array center staff can unlock the order from this interface to allow edits.
This field displays the total number of samples.
This field displays and allows edits to the billing code. The billing code is initially set by the member user when configuring the array order, however it can be overridden by array center staff.

There are several fields in this interface that allow the array center staff to track significant dates. They include the "Chips Bill Date" field, the "Preps Bill Date" field, the "Date Report Completed" field, the "Isolation Bill Date" field, and the "Date Samples Received" field. It is the responsibility of the array center staff to keep these fields current. The values stored here are used in generating reports.
This field contains the hybridization name.
This field displays the layout associated with the chip.
This field displays the name of the array study associated with the array order and the hybridization.
This field displays the name of the experimental condition associated with the hybridization.
This field appears to display the current data.

Once chip data has been loaded, the load button associated with the hybridization disappears, and a quality control link is displayed instead. This link takes array center staff to a page that displays the quality control values associated with the hybridization. The values originate from the chip data files.

When the chip experiment is run, chip data files are generated by the software (Microarray Suite or GCOS). These files need to be placed in the chip data path. Once the files are there and available to &product;, you can load data by clicking on the "Load All" button for a specific array order (or by clicking the individual load buttons available for each hybridization to load one at a time)

Once data has been loaded, the buttons to load hybridizations are replaced with links. The links are labeled with the date that the data was loaded and the links lead to the quality control information.

Note that data is loaded based on a specific naming convention. Files are expected to be named via the following convention: If the file is named incorrectly the data will not be loaded and an error will be returned that states the name of the file the system is looking for.
